intro: Epilobium prionophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, often wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. Epilobium prionophyllum is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
